name: American Imam Academy
mission: The American Imam’s Academy aims to prepare the next generation of Imams rooted in the traditional sciences and trained in guiding American Muslim communities.
programs: Bachelor’s in Islamic Theology and Da’wah
theoryOfChange: By training the next generation of Imams in both traditional sciences and contemporary American issues, the academy ensures communities are guided by leaders who are spiritually grounded and culturally relevant.
zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of 'zakat' on the American Imam Academy's website or donation pages in the search results. The organization's mission focuses on training imams and providing Islamic education and community services, but does not explicitly state that it accepts zakat donations. (Source: https://imamsacademy.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; moderate program ratio (≥65%)

components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 25/50, the charity addresses the urgent cause of global education but shows low donor fit for those seeking high-transparency organizations [3]. The academy offers various ways to give, including sadaqah, though it does not provide detailed public reporting on its long-term track record [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to its mission by directing 70.2% of its $824,033 total revenue toward its programs [1]. While it maintains a healthy 48.4 months of working capital, the overall impact score of 27/50 is limited by a lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data and a focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery [3].

strengths_deep_dive: American Imams Academy demonstrates solid financial fundamentals for a growing educational institution. The organization reported <cite id="1">Total Revenue of $824,033</cite> in its most recent filing, supported by a <cite id="4">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 11.9%</cite>. Its operational efficiency is highlighted by a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 70.2%</cite> and an impressive fundraising efficiency of <cite id="3">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: American Imams Academy is an educational non-profit organization that operates an academy and a masjid to serve its community. The organization reported <cite id="1">Total Revenue of $824,033</cite> in 2023. It maintains a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 70.2%</cite>, indicating a majority of funds go toward core services. The charity demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending <cite id="3">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. Over the past three years, the organization has seen a <cite id="4">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 11.9%</cite>. The organization accepts sadaqah and general charitable contributions to support its mission of religious and academic instruction. It operates with <cite id="6">Total Assets of $2,195,479</cite> and <cite id="7">Total Liabilities of $522,107</cite>. The organization is governed by a <cite id="8">board of 7 members</cite> and focuses its programs within the <cite id="10">USA geographic coverage</cite> area.
